I Had A Dream. It Was Just KSP 2 Though. It Has A Tutorial System And Paying System Plus The Ability To Build Towers. Any And All Rememberences Of This Dream Will Be Told.

 

Its Kind Of Basic Though. Same Thing As KSP In Terms Of Looks, Just With A Tower And The Ability To Turn The Camera To Choose The Things.

In The VAB Tutorial You Learn That You Sometimes Have To Pay Kerbals That Work With You (Or Your Kerbals) During Their Contract With You. This Tutorial Is During The Construction Of The VAB I Guess. Maybe This Dream Is Sight Of The Future. Maybe The Current KSP2 Is At This Status? I Don't Really Know. Thats Actually All Of The Dream. Maybe Next Dream Will Be The Exact Same But Continuing The Game. In This Dream Though, I Was Truly Playing The Game. And Did Not Know What To Do Next...

♫ Dreams will survive ♫

2 possibilities here...

  • This will be picked up for a new mod.
  • Your a seer... unlikely but who knows

I don't think there will ever be a KSP2 but its a good idea nonetheless. Maybe for a mod or updates.

Good thing im not the only one who dreams about videogames XD

Oh And Adding Capital Letters To Every Word Makes It Sort Of Hard To Read, just sayin though.

Since this is more about someone's dream than the game, the thread has been moved to the Lounge. 

Also, please don't mock each other's posting styles, and just be glad to have others to share our KSP enthusiasm with.

On 29-9-2017 at 11:48 AM, NSEP said:

I don't think there will ever be a KSP2

 

Why not?

16 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:

Why not?

KSP is not a game with a story so it does not specifically need a sequel. It will do just fine with updates.

20 minutes ago, NSEP said:

KSP is not a game with a story so it does not specifically need a sequel. It will do just fine with updates.

We got more than one flight simulator, don't we?

 I can think of several reasons a KSP 2 would be great. For one, they could use another game engine that would allow stuff that is currently hard to achieve.

Features like

  • Multiplayer
  • N-Body simulation
  • Detailed/Custom procedural generated terrain
  • Dynamic Environment (weather, climate, dust storms)
  • Moving inside space vessels at zero-G or low gravity.
  • Subterrain construction
  • Terrestrial/Alien life
  • Relativity

These features would definitely  justify a new version
